header: Test vectors of type MlDsaVerify are meant for the verification of ML-DSA signatures

BoundaryCondition.description: This case exercises a boundary condition (e.g. in the signing rejection loop). The verification algorithm may not notice.

IncorrectPublicKeyLength.description: The public key has an incorrect length.

IncorrectSignatureLength.description: The signature has an incorrect length.

InvalidHintsEncoding.description: The encoding of hints in the signature is invalid (e.g. non-canonical order).

InvalidPrivateKey.description: The private key is invalid, but the verifier does not know that.

ManySteps.description: This case requires many steps (e.g. many hashes in the matrix expansion, many iterations in the signing rejection loop). The verification algorithm may not notice.

ModifiedSignature.description: The test vector contains an invalid signature, generated by modifying a valid signature (e.g. flipping a bit).

ValidSignature.description: The test vector contains a valid signature.

ZeroPublicKey.description: The public key contains a zero vector. This makes it trivial to forge signatures, but that's none of the verification algorithm's business.

tests.comment: signature with a bit flip in c_tilde
signature with a bit flip in z[0]
signature with a bit flip in z[1]
signature with a bit flip in z[2]
signature with a bit flip in z[3]
signature with a bit flip in hints
signature with a bit flip in the last byte
signature with hints in reverse order
signature with too many hints (causing a buffer overflow)
signature with non-zero padding in hints
signature with omega+1 hints (causing a buffer overflow)
private key with s2 vector out of range
high_bits called on the edge case
low_bits called on the edge case
private key with s1 vector out of range
public key with t1 component set to zero
